items.title: Robust Output, ‘Warmest Christmas on Record’ Forecasts, Trip up Natural Gas Futures
items.summary: Natural gas futures retreated Monday but stabilized off session lows as traders weighed exceptionally mild Christmas week forecasts and record high production against colder midday forecasts.

items.title: Early Bounce Fizzles Midday as January Natural Gas Turns Lower
items.summary: January natural gas futures gave up early short-covering gains and moved lower as weak fundamentals reasserted themselves.

items.title: Small Change in Forecast EIA Storage Pull Enough to Reduce Surplus to 5-Year Average
items.summary: NGI is projecting the latest Lower 48 U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report through the week ended Dec. 19 to show a withdrawal of 170 Bcf.

items.title: Questions Linger Over Private Sector Role in Mexico’s Natural Gas Power Expansion
items.summary: As Mexico doubles down on a state-centric energy model, private natural gas players are still searching for ways to contribute, according to analysts.

items.title: Great Basin Secures 800 MMcf/d in Commitments for $1.7B Northern Nevada Natural Gas Expansion
items.summary: Great Basin Gas Transmission Co. locked in nearly 800 MMcf/d in binding shipper commitments following a second supplemental open season that underscored growing demand for gas in Northern Nevada.

items.title: Deloitte Expert Forecasts ‘Exciting’ 2026 for U.S. Energy as Innovations Propel Natural Gas, Power

items.title: Short-Covering Drives Gas Higher as Colder Signals Clash With Warm Reality

items.title: Could Geopolitics Gatecrash The Bearish Oil Market?
items.summary: Geopolitical developments have moved oil prices in both directions in recent days. Yet, the movements up or down were short-lived and smaller than they would have been if the market were tight or balanced.   But the feared oversupply is already here,

items.title: Oil Glut Will Prompt Faster Market Rebalance
items.summary: Everyone seems to be in agreement: global oil supply is greater than the demand for the fuel. The consensus stands despite the fact that some of the world’s biggest storage hubs are far from overflowing. Now, many forecast even more production coming

items.title: What Would A Peace Deal In Ukraine Mean For The Global Oil Market?
items.summary: The prospect of a peace deal in Ukraine has been gaining momentum in the global oil market over the past few days, stripping away part of the geopolitical risk premium that has kept prices elevated since Russia’s invasion on 24 February 2022. Followi

items.title: Trump Enters the Race for Fusion Power
items.summary: Shares of Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. (NYSE:DJT) have surged nearly 70% after the company agreed to merge with fusion startup TAE Technologies in a $6 billion deal. Under the terms of the deal, shareholders of each company will own roughly h

items.title: Shell, INEOS Energy Discover Oil In The Gulf of America
items.summary: Shell and INEOS Energy have struck oil at a deepwater exploration well in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico, confirming a new discovery in the high-pressure Norphlet formation. Shell and INEOS Energy said the Nashville exploration well encountered high-quality

items.title: Why Nuclear Fusion Will Not Solve the AI Power Problem

items.title: Glencore Acquires Majority Stake In Dutch Fuel Supplier
items.summary: Global commodities trader Glencore has acquired a majority stake in Dutch fuel supplier FincoEnergies, the Dutch company revealed on Monday, with industry sources noting that the trader intends to use the acquisition to expand its Northwest European

items.title: Oil Prices Surge 2% on Venezuela, Russia Disruption Fears
